duties_responsibilities.duty: Manage a clinic and perform normal Audiologist/Hearing Aid Dispenser duties such as diagnosing and treating hearing loss, providing clinical expertise, and ensuring a positive patient experience.
Create an exceptional patient journey through patient care and appropriate treatment options.
Provide quality care and aftercare of dispensing services such as hearing tests, hearing aid fittings, educating and training hearing aid users of best practices.

Conduct checks on hearing aids and other amplification devices, troubleshooting, repairs, earmold cleaning, and promote sales and key business metrics while focusing on providing quality patient care.
Develop a relationship with local community leaders by representing the clinic as an advocate and maintain an active Hearing Aid Dispensing License in accordance with state requirements.
Maintain continuing education requirements based on state requirements and operate audiometric equipment to interpret the results.

skills.skill: Degree in Audiology or Experienced Hearing Instrument Specialist
Audiometric equipment operation and result interpretation

education_certification.credential: Degree in Audiology or experienced Hearing Instrument Specialist
